body.section:
The quickest way to get started is to obtain one of the pre-built packages. Even when adding additional functionalities to Hippo ECM, you normally don't need to rebuild Hippo-ECM. This because more functionality can be added by simply adding the JARs containing the add-ons to the already packaged product, or uploading them into the running packaged product. There is therefor no need to rebuild from all the sources, one of the two pre-built package can always be customized.
The quickstart packages are the same packages as the core packaged products are detailed in X, but have been pre-configured with a number of modules and settings, such to give you a quick overview of the product, without having to laborious tasks to first enter content, etcetera.
Hippo-ECM is a web-based application, and therefor is intended to run inside a servlet or application container. These containers accept pre-built applications in the form of a WAR or EAR archive package, and provide basic functions to Hippo-ECM and management of your application. To get you quickly started, first determin the platform you which to use to run Hippo ECM. Then;
Download either the WAR or EAR package. For deployment in Tomcat or Jetty, use the WAR package. The EARs less configuration and can grow with your needs (see discussion in X), but require an application container to run in.
Notice: note that Hippo ECM has not been released. The following downloads are snapshots of the current build.
quickstart war package
quickstart ear package
Now follow the guidelines for the platform you are using:
Deploy WAR in Tomcat
Deploy WAR in Jetty
Deploy EAR or WAR in glassfish
It should be possible to deploy these downloads in other servlet or application containers. Select the closest resembling container above and repoduce the steps adapted for your other container if your container is not listed above.
